intro: Amsinckia mandonii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Amsinckia mandonii is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun and drought conditions.
